0	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-trump-minorities-idUSKCN1160C0	Trump calls Democrats 'party of slavery' in minority outreach effort	"
By Emily Stephenson
| EVERETT
column2: Washington

column1: EVERETT
column2: Washington Republican Donald Trump on Tuesday night called Democrats the ""party of slavery"" and praised what he called the millions of African Americans with career success
column3: as he tries to revamp his outreach to minority voters.Trump has made much-maligned efforts to appeal to black and Hispanic voters
column4: groups that generally support Democrats and are expected to vote heavily for Hillary Clinton in the Nov. 8 election.""The Republican Party is the party of Abraham Lincoln
column5: Trump said at a rally in Everett
column6: Washington. ""It is the Democratic Party that is the party of slavery
column7: the party of Jim Crow and the party of opposition
column9: referring to racial segregation laws that once existed in the American South.

column1: The Republican nominee has said Democrats failed minority voters with economic policies that have not improved their job prospects
column2: but his attempts have been criticized for painting a bleak view of the lives of all black and Hispanic Americans.Clinton last week released an ad mocking Trump's attempts to reach those groups and showing headlines about a racial discrimination lawsuit the New York real estate mogul faced in the 1970s.

column1: A prominent supporter of Trump's apologized on Tuesday for sending out a tweet that showed a cartoon image of Clinton in blackface.Trump sought to correct course in Washington state on Tuesday
column2: saying millions of black Americans ""have succeeded greatly"" in art
column3: science
column4: sports and other endeavors.

column1: But we must also talk about those who have been left behind
column2: the millions suffering in disastrous conditions in so many of our inner cities
column3: he said.  (Reporting by Emily Stephenson; Editing by Clarence Fernandez)"

column1: 1	http://reuters.com/article/us-arizona-election-sheriff-idUSKCN1160CR	Veteran Arizona sheriff defeats three in Republican primary	"
By David Schwartz
| PHOENIX
PHOENIX The Arizona sheriff famous for his tough stance on illegal immigration and keeping jail inmates in tents easily won his Republican primary on Tuesday.Maricopa County Sheriff Joe Arpaio
column2: who is seeking election to a seventh term as the top lawman for the area around Phoenix
column3: won about 66 percent of the vote
column4: well ahead of ex-police chief and three-time opponent Dan Saban
column5: according to unofficial election results posted online by the county.Also on the Republican primary ballot were Wayne Baker
column8: an ex-sheriff's volunteer. Arpaio is slated to face Democrat Paul Penzone
column9: who was unopposed in his party's primary
column11: a former Phoenix police officer who is expected to present a tough challenge to Arpaio in November
column12: lost to the longtime sheriff in 2012 by six percentage points.Arpaio
column14: was expected to win his primary despite a judge's request that criminal contempt charges be brought against him stemming from a 2007 racial profiling case where he was found to have violated the constitutional rights of Latino motorists.

column1: The investigation and possible prosecution was turned over to the U.S. Justice Department last week. It was not clear when a decision would be made.Arpaio
column2: who styles himself as America's toughest sheriff
column3: said his looming legal battles apparently had no effect on the primary race. ""I think the people understand that they should not believe everything they hear
column4: Arpaio told Reuters in a telephone interview. ""They support me as they always have and that feels good.""

column1: Saban has called on Arpaio to resign
column2: saying the sheriff has ""soiled his badge"" and made himself ineffective as a lawman.Saban declined comment on the election results through a spokesman
column3: adding that he would issue a statement on Wednesday morning.

column1: Arpaio
column2: along with three others
column3: could face incarceration and fines if convicted of any criminal charges. Arpaio and his second-in-command
column4: Gerard Sheridan
column5: already have been cited and admitted to civil contempt.    The charges center on unlawful traffic stops and detentions by deputies of Latino drivers for 18 months after the judge ordered them to cease.Opponents also have targeted the profiling lawsuit's high cost to the county
column6: which will have spent an estimated $54 million on the case by next summer. (Editing by Sharon Bernstein and Toby Chopra)"

column1: 2	http://reuters.com/article/us-maine-lepage-idUSKCN1151VD	Maine governor mulls political future amid racism flap	"
By Scott Malone
| BOSTON

BOSTON (Editor's note: This story contains language that may offend some readers in the sixth and final paragraphs adds no comment from Gattine spokesman)Combative Maine Governor Paul LePage told a radio host on Tuesday that he was considering not finishing his term in office
column2: amid a wave of criticism after he left a lawmaker a profanity-filled voicemail.But the two-term
column3: Tea Party-backed Republican governor subsequently appeared to backtrack on the idea
column4: paraphrasing Mark Twain in a tweet that read in part: ""The reports of my political demise are greatly exaggerated.""That message came hours after he told an interviewer on Maine's WVOM-FM radio that he was ""looking at all options
column5: when asked if he would finish his term
column6: which extends through 2018.LePage's latest outburst came in response to a report that state Representative Drew Gattine had described him as racist for focusing on black people as bearing primary responsibility for the drug trade in the state. LePage responded to Gattine with a blistering
column7: profanity-laced voicemail that has been widely circulated.""I'm not going to say that I'm not going to finish it; I'm not saying that I am going to finish it
column8: LePage said on Tuesday in the radio interview
column9: in reference to his term in office. ""What I'm going to do right now is I'm taking one step at a time. I want to meet with Mr. Gattine and then I want to meet with my team at my office and we're going to look at what the proper steps are to move the state forward.""In last week's voicemail
column11: socialist cocksucker"" and encouraged him to share the message publicly ""because I am after you.""A LePage spokeswoman did not immediately respond to a request to clarify the governor's Twain tweet. A spokeswoman for Gattine said he would not comment until after he met LePage on Wednesday.

column1: LePage has repeatedly described himself as a less-than-polished
column2: plain-speaking politician.""It's possible it was a screw-up
column3: said Michael Franz
column4: chairman of the government department at Maine's Bowdoin College
column5: referring to the radio interview.""My first inclination is that this is not serious and that he's just attempting to establish his regret.""

column1: APOLOGY TO MAINE
column2: FAMILIES

column1: LePage
column3: said he had lost his temper when he was told that Gattine had described his views as racist. He told reporters he would like to engage in a duel with Gattine
column4: a remark he later described as metaphoric.""I just want to apologize to the Maine people
column5: to Gattine's family and most of all to my family
column6: LePage said in the 15-minute interview. ""And we will take action.""Some Democratic lawmakers have called for a special session of the legislature to censure LePage
column7: who earlier this year fought off an impeachment effort.""A half-hearted
column8: partial apology on a radio show does not get remotely close to addressing the core issue: Maine faces serious issues and its government is not functioning
column9: the state's Democratic House leadership said in a statement on Tuesday.

column1: State Senate President Michael Thibodeau and other Republican legislative leaders convened a closed-door meeting with LePage late on Monday to discuss his future.The governor told the group he was going to talk to friends and family about what he would do next and respond to them on Tuesday
column2: said Jim Cyr
column3: a spokesman for Thibodeau.Controversial outbursts have marked LePage's six years in office. Earlier this year
column4: he said he did not mean to sound racist when he said drug dealers ""with the name D-Money
column5: Smoothie
column6: Shifty"" were coming to the state to impregnate ""white girls.""Last week at a news conference LePage compared Maine's efforts to thwart heroin dealers to war.""Look
column7: the bad guy is the bad guy
column8: he said. ""I don't care what color he is ... You try to identify the enemy and the enemy right now
column9: the overwhelming majority of people coming in
column10: are people of color or people of Hispanic origin.""In 2013
column11: he told a television interviewer that a political rival ""claims to be for the people but he's the first one to give it to the people without providing Vaseline."" (Reporting by Scott Malone; Editing by Bill Trott and Dan Grebler)"

column1: 3	http://reuters.com/article/us-mylan-nl-prices-lawmakers-idUSKCN1152VV	Senators press Mylan on 'exorbitantly expensive' EpiPen	"
By Diane Bartz
| WASHINGTON
WASHINGTON Democrat Elizabeth Warren and 19 other U.S. senators voiced concern to the chief executive of Mylan NV (MYL.O) about the high cost of its EpiPen on Tuesday
column2: calling the device used in the case of life-threatening allergies ""exorbitantly expensive.""Mylan has been under fire for steadily raising the price of the device from about $100 in 2008 to about $600 currently.In a letter to Mylan CEO Heather Bresch
column3: the daughter of Senator Joe Manchin of West Virginia
column4: the lawmakers asked the company to spell out the company's programs to provide some people with lower cost EpiPens.Such discount programs are often an ""industry tactic to keep costs high through a complex shell game
column5: the letter said.""Insurance companies
column6: the government and employers still bear the burden of these excessive prices. In turn
column7: those costs are eventually passed on to consumers in the form of higher premiums

column1: Mylan said this week it would launch the first generic version of its allergy auto-injector EpiPen for $300
column2: half the price of the branded product
column3: the drugmaker's second step in less than a week to counter the backlash over the product's steep price. It also reduced the out-of-pocket costs of EpiPen for some patients last week.EpiPen has a 94 percent market share for auto-injector devices
column4: which jab a dose of the drug epinephrine into the thigh to counter dangerous allergic reactions such as to peanuts
column5: other foods and bee stings.

column1: Asked about the letter
column2: Mylan spokeswoman Lauren Kashtan said in an email statement: ""We have acknowledged receipt of letters from congressional offices and intend to respond to them.""Mylan has defended EpiPen's high price
column3: saying it spent hundreds of millions of dollars to improve the product since acquiring it in 2007. It has also said it recoups less than half the list price for EpiPens.In their letter
column4: the lawmakers asked Mylan how much insurers paid for the EpiPen in 2009 and how much they pay now. They also asked how many EpiPens Mylan provided to low income
column5: uninsured consumers and how many schools purchased EpiPens versus how many received them for free.

column1: In addition to Warren
column2: other signatories included Senators Patrick Leahy of Vermont
column3: the top Democrat on the Judiciary Committee; Barbara Boxer
column4: a California Democrat; Dick Durbin
column5: an Illinois Democrat; Jack Reed and Sheldon Whitehouse
column6: both Democrats from Rhode Island and Sherrod Brown
column7: an Ohio Democrat. (Reporting by Diane Bartz; Editing by Tom Brown)"

column1: 4	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-idUSKCN1152QU	Trade critic Trump visits Boeing Co's backyard	"
By Emily Stephenson and Ginger Gibson
| EVERETT
column2: Washington/WASHINGTON

column1: EVERETT
column2: Washington/WASHINGTON Republican Donald Trump
column3: who has made his criticism of a pending Pacific trade agreement central to his campaign
column4: on Tuesday visited a Seattle suburb home to a large Boeing Co plane manufacturing facility that depends heavily on Asian sales.Trump vowed at his rally that he would win Washington state
column5: even though the state tends to support Democrats and that party's nominee
column7: leads by large margins in opinion polls ahead of the Nov. 8 election.The Republican nominee
column9: presents a conundrum for the unions that represent workers at Boeing
column10: the world's largest aerospace company. He has courted manufacturing workers with vows to tear up trade agreements and scrap the 12-nation Trans-Pacific Partnership. ""The destruction that NAFTA started will be finished off if the Trans-Pacific Partnership is approved
column12: referring to a separate deal with Canada and Mexico reached in the 1990s. He also has vowed to renegotiate that agreement.Supporters of the Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP) point to Boeing's aircraft sales to Asia to tout the benefits of the agreement. Secretary of State John Kerry visited a nearby plant earlier this year to rally support for the pact.Manufacturing unions agree with Trump on his opposition to TPP and the export of jobs overseas
column13: but officials said they find his track record unconvincing.""The fact is that Trump has had the opportunity to bring jobs to Americans
column14: and he's chosen to outsource them
column16: legislative and political director for the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers District Lodge 751
column19: mostly at Boeing.Boeing produces some of its largest planes only miles from where Trump spoke Tuesday night. As they are assembled
column20: the painted tails of the planes show the airlines that ordered them
column21: and many are Asian. Major components of each plane come from overseas: South Korea

column1: Over the next 20 years
column2: Boeing projects that Asian customers will account for 40 percent of the total global jetliner's market
column3: the company said in a recent report.""Trade is a huge part of the success of manufacturing in Washington
column4: said Linda Dempsey
column5: vice president of international economic affairs for the National Association of Manufacturers
column6: which Boeing belongs to. ""They are exporting $73 billion in manufactured goods.""But Trump offers a more dire outlook
column7: arguing that only he can keep Boeing from moving those high-paying manufacturing jobs from Washington to China.""They'll start taking your business away
column8: and you won't have much of Boeing
column9: Trump told Seattle's KIRO radio on Monday.

column1: RALLYING WORKERS
Trump has broken with the Republican Party's traditional embrace of free trade. He has vowed to rip up the TPP and renegotiate the North American Free Trade Agreement
column2: or NAFTA
column3: an existing deal with Canada and Mexico which he blames for the loss of U.S. jobs.The Republican Party's support for free trade has put it in sync with large business groups such as the Chamber of Commerce and the National Association of Manufacturers.Tony Fratto
column4: a former official in the administration of Republican George W. Bush
column5: criticized Trump as out of step with the party.

column1: Trump's policies in this area are really dumb generally
column2: but are particularly dumb for a major exporting company
column3: said Fratto
column4: who worked on behalf of a coalition of large companies
column5: including Boeing
column6: that were pushing for renewal of the Export-Import Bank.Some voters in Washington state remain divided. Kirk Hoeppner
column8: a business analyst at Boeing who lives in Granite Falls
column10: said he will vote for Trump and he agrees with his business views. But he was not sure closer ties to other countries would hurt jobs there.""Even if we ally with other countries
column11: we're still going to sell more airplanes
column16: has not decided whom he will vote for.""The union members love Hillary just because they're supposed to because she's a liberal
column18: whom he called ""just kind of a big show
column19: may be too late to change anything.""This company's been outsourcing jobs for years
column20: he said of Boeing. (Writing by Ginger Gibson; Reporting by Emily Stephenson in Everett
column21: Washington; Alwyn Scott in Seattle and Ginger Gibson in Washington; Editing by Caren Bohan and Jonathan Oatis)"

column1: 5	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-mccain-idUSKCN1160BC	U.S. Senator McCain wins Arizona Republican nominating contest	"
WASHINGTON Senator John McCain survived a Tea Party challenge when he won Arizona's Republican nominating contest on Tuesday
column2: enabling him to seek a sixth term as U.S. senator from the southwestern state
column3: according to media projections.McCain
column5: defeated former Arizona state Senator Kelli Ward and is slated to defend his Senate seat against Democratic  Representative Ann Kirkpatrick in the Nov. 8 election.

column1: (Reporting by Richard Cowan; Editing by Christopher Cushing and Paul Tait)"
6	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-trump-mexico-visit-idUSKCN116084	Mexico says president Pena Nieto to meet Trump on Wednesday	"
MEXICO CITY Mexican President Enrique Pena Nieto will meet U.S. Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump for a private meeting on Wednesday
column2: Pena Nieto's office said via Twitter on Tuesday.The Mexican presidency said the government had sent an invitation to both Trump and Democratic hopeful Hillary Clinton for talks and that Trump's team had accepted.

column1: A spokesman for the Mexican presidency said the meeting would be in Mexico and that details of the encounter were still being worked out.
(Reporting by Dave Graham)"
7	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-wasserman-schultz-idUSKCN116045	Wasserman Schultz wins Florida Democratic nod in House race: Miami Herald	"
WASHINGTON U.S. Representative Debbie Wasserman Schultz of Florida
column2: who last month lost her job as head of the Democratic National Committee
column3: won a bid on Tuesday to be her party's nominee for a seventh term in the U.S. House of Representatives
column4: the Miami Herald reported.The newspaper projected that Wasserman Schultz defeated Tim Canova
column5: a law professor who is an outspoken Wall Street critic. He is aligned with U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders
column6: who lost the Democratic presidential nomination to former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton.

column1: (Reporting by Richard Cowan; Editing by Peter Cooney)"
8	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-clinton-idUSKCN1151ZC	FBI to give media some Clinton notes over email use: CNN	"

WASHINGTON The FBI plans to hand over some of its notes from its interview with U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton regarding her use of private email while secretary of state to news outlets that requested them
column2: CNN reported on Tuesday.However
column3: the Federal Bureau of Investigation will not yet release other notes from the law enforcement agency's interviews with Clinton aides or turn over other investigative material
column4: CNN said
column5: citing unnamed sources.The materials could be released as soon as Wednesday to media companies that formally sought them under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA)
column6: according to CNN.FBI representatives declined to confirm the report to Reuters.

column1: In addition to the notes
column2: CNN said the FBI will give the news outlets the roughly 30-page report it sent to the U.S. Department of Justice last month when it recommended against pursuing criminal charges against Clinton
column3: who is vying for the White House in the Nov. 8 U.S. election.The Clinton campaign
column4: which had expressed concern about selective leaks from the notes
column5: welcomed the release.

column1: This is something that we wanted to have happen
column2: campaign spokeswoman Kristina Schake told CNN in an interview.  Several media outlets
column3: including Reuters
column4: have made FOIA requests for a summary of the interview. Such requests are often returned with sensitive information redacted.

column1: FBI Director James Comey told Congress that the interview was not recorded
column2: so the agency would only be able to provide a summary. (Reporting by Julia Edwards and David Alexander; Writing by Susan Heavey; Editing by Jonathan Oatis)"

column1: 9	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-trump-burns-idUSKCN1152IO	Trump booster apologizes for Clinton 'blackface' tweet	"
WASHINGTON Pastor Marks Burns
column2: a prominent supporter of Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump
column3: apologized on Tuesday for sending out a tweet that showed a cartoon image of Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton in blackface.Burns
column4: an African-American who is frequently one of the warmup speakers at Trump rallies
column5: sent out the tweet on Monday to bolster the Trump campaign's contention that Clinton is pandering for the black vote but will ignore the community if elected on Nov. 8.""I ain't no ways pandering to African Americans
column6: the cartoon image says. The tweet emerged at a time when Trump has been trying to broaden his appeal to African-American voters by saying he wants to create more jobs and make black neighborhoods safe so people can walk down the street without getting shot.

column1: After Burns began taking fire for the tweet
column2: he deleted it and apologized for the image but not his message.""I'm so sorry for the offensive #Blackface image of @HillaryClinton but stand by the message that we Blacks ARE being Used by #Dems for VOTES
column3: Burns said.

column1: (Reporting by Steve Holland; Editing by Leslie Adler)"
